definition: to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Frontline turnover is one of the biggest headaches for call center managers.
sentences.chinese: 对治理者来说，一线坐席辞职是最为头痛的标题。

sentences.english: He tried to avoid meeting me like plague since he had resigned.
sentences.chinese: 自从辞职后，他就如避蛇蝎般地躲着我。

sentences.english: Yes, I was last year formal abdication comes down to run Hefei group to buy a network.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我是去年正式辞职下来运作合肥团购网的。

sentences.english: In addition, Wal-Mart China Human Resources Senior Vice President Wang Yujia resigns.
sentences.chinese: 此外，沃尔玛中国人力资源高级副总裁王渝佳已辞职。

sentences.english: He said he hoped rumours that Brown would quit would come true.
sentences.chinese: 他希望布朗因为身体原因提前辞职的传言成真。

sentences.english: The refused to comment on the rumors of his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 部偿拒盔疚他辞职一事的传纹发表评论。

sentences.english: Announcing his resignation, Haarde said he had throat cancer.
sentences.chinese: 在宣布辞职的同时，Haarade称自己患有喉癌。

sentences.english: There are new calls for South Carolina's embattled Governor to quit.
sentences.chinese: 又有新的呼声要求南卡罗莱那州长辞职。

sentences.english: Article 169. An independent director may submit his resignation before the expiration of his term.
sentences.chinese: 第一百六十九条独立董事在任期届满钱可以提出辞职。

sentences.english: The resignation of Mr Tung Chee-hwa has been the focus of attention among compatriots in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 董先生辞职是香港同胞十分关注的一件事情。

sentences.english: He writes his letter of resignation to the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他向董事长写了辞职信。

sentences.english: He paced up and down in front of his boss's door, still not brave enough to resign.
sentences.chinese: 他在老板门前来回蹀躞，还是没有勇气提出辞职。

sentences.english: I filed my resignation with the department.
sentences.chinese: 我向系里呈递了辞职书。

sentences.english: Frontline turnover is one of the biggest headaches for call center managers. There are many reasons why agents quit.
sentences.chinese: 对治理者来说，一线坐席辞职是最为头痛的标题。

sentences.english: The revelation of his past lead to his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 对他过去的揭露导致了他的辞职。

sentences.english: In many cases, when you turn in your  resignation, you're done.
sentences.chinese: 很多情况下，在你提交了辞职书后，你就完了。

definition: to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to quit one's job (without having another one)
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to ask sb to resign from a post
to take a vacation/to go on holiday
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
